Al-Mi'raj

This creature looks like a large rabbit with a unicorn-like horn protruding from its head.



Al-Mi'raj

CR 1

XP 400
N Small magical beast
Init +3; Senses darkvision 60 ft., scent; Perception +6
DEFENSE
AC 14, touch 14, flat-footed 11 (+3 Dex, +1 size)
hp 6 (1d10+1)
Fort +3, Ref +5, Will +1
Immune poison; SR 16
OFFENSE
Spd 40 ft.
Melee gore +5 (1d4-2)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Spell-Like Abilities (CL 4th)
At will—quickened blink, dimension door (self only)
STATISTICS
Str 6, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 5, Wis 12, Cha 6
Base Atk +1; CMB -2; CMD 11
Feats Nimble MovesB, Weapon Finesse
Skills Stealth +8, Perception +6, Survival +2; Racial Modifiers +4 Perception
ECOLOGY
Environment temperate plains
Organization solitary, warren (2-20)
Treasure none


The al-mi'raj is a dangerous creature with long white, pink, yellow, or light green fur. Its horn is golden or black in color. Because of the al-mi'raj's interdimensional travel abilities, sages often refer to them as "blink bunnies."
